segments.text: I see the boy stretching up toward the cookie jar, his tiny fingers almost brushing the lid.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There's an innocence in his determination that makes me smile, but it’s quickly overshadowed by anxiety.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That stool looks so unstable, and I can’t help but picture him tumbling to the ground.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman seems so lost in her own world, polishing that plate as if it will bring her peace.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she ever looks up to see what’s happening right beside her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle at her feet grows larger; it’s almost mesmerizing in its own chaotic way.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout, to warn them both, but something holds me back.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sister’s expression, full of hope as she reaches for the cookie, pulls at my heart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This situation feels loaded with unspoken dangers, and I can’t quite process it all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast of the tranquil garden outside and the impending chaos inside feels almost poetic.
segments.speaker: PAR
